lessons.title: Welcome to CS101!
masteryOutcomes: Understand the course structure and main topics

lessons.title: Naming that tells a story
masteryOutcomes: Rename variables and functions to improve clarity

lessons.title: Crafting docstrings that explain the why
masteryOutcomes: Write docstrings that explain the purpose and usage of functions

lessons.title: ⚙ Practice Lesson: Cafe order helper
masteryOutcomes: Practice renaming variables/functions and adding clear docstrings so a short “cafe order” script becomes self-explanatory to a new reader.
lessons.teachingInstructions: Practice-oriented session with a real world story and theme; Create a step by step exercise where the student is writing code and you approve each step; Don't teach any new topics, rely only on the lessons covered

lessons.title: Writing comments with real purpose
masteryOutcomes: Add comments that clarify reasoning instead of obvious behavior

lessons.title: Keeping it clean
masteryOutcomes: Apply consistent formatting for whitespace, indentation, and line breaks

lessons.title: Making code instantly readable
masteryOutcomes: Rewrite code to pass a readability checklist

lessons.title: ⚙ Practice Lesson: Weather report formatter
masteryOutcomes: Improve an existing “weather report” script by adding purposeful comments, cleaning formatting, and rewriting sections to be instantly readable.
lessons.teachingInstructions: Practice-oriented session with a real world story and theme; Create a step by step exercise where the student is writing code and you approve each step; Don't teach any new topics, rely only on the lessons covered

lessons.title: Turning long scripts into sharp functions
masteryOutcomes: Understand why long monolithic scripts reduce readability, reusability, and maintainability.
Split a long script into focused functions with well-defined signatures.

lessons.title: Following program flow with print tracing
masteryOutcomes: Insert print-based tracing statements to follow program execution

lessons.title: ⚙ Practice Lesson: To-do list organizer - Part 1
masteryOutcomes: Refactor a long “to-do list organizer” script into small, focused functions with clear names and signatures.
lessons.teachingInstructions: Practice-oriented session with a real world story and theme; Create a step by step exercise where the student is writing code and you approve each step; Don't teach any new topics, rely only on the lessons covered

lessons.title: ⚙ Practice Lesson: To-do list organizer - Part 2
masteryOutcomes: Add print-based tracing to the refactored to-do list program to follow program flow and debug logic step by step.
lessons.teachingInstructions: Practice-oriented session with a real world story and theme; Create a step by step exercise where the student is writing code and you approve each step; Don't teach any new topics, rely only on the lessons covered

lessons.title: Using invariants as safety checkpoints
masteryOutcomes: Understand how invariants help ensure program correctness and prevent bugs.
Apply invariants to check assumptions at key points in the code.

lessons.title: Designing functions that can be reused anywhere
masteryOutcomes: Use parameters and return values to ensure modular function design

lessons.title: ⚙ Practice Lesson: Budget tracker - Part 1
masteryOutcomes: Add invariants to a simple “budget tracker” program to enforce assumptions about balances, transactions, and categories.
lessons.teachingInstructions: Practice-oriented session with a real world story and theme; Create a step by step exercise where the student is writing code and you approve each step; Don't teach any new topics, rely only on the lessons covered

lessons.title: ⚙ Practice Lesson: Budget tracker - Part 2
masteryOutcomes: Redesign budget-related logic into reusable functions with parameters and return values so the code can be reused in new budgeting scenarios.
lessons.teachingInstructions: Practice-oriented session with a real world story and theme; Create a step by step exercise where the student is writing code and you approve each step; Don't teach any new topics, rely only on the lessons covered

lessons.title: Pushing the limits
masteryOutcomes: Understand how clear input and output boundaries ensure reliable, predictable program behavior.
Design and implement tests that verify code correctness at boundary and edge conditions.

lessons.title: Validating inputs before they break things
masteryOutcomes: Implement input validation to prevent unexpected behavior

lessons.title: The art of a well-placed error
masteryOutcomes: Write clear error messages and handle invalid inputs gracefully

lessons.title: ⚙ Practice Lesson: Ticket booking validator
masteryOutcomes: Practice defining clear input/output boundaries, validating user input, and returning helpful error messages for a simple ticket booking flow.

lessons.title: Refactoring with confidence
masteryOutcomes: Perform safe refactoring moves such as renaming, extracting functions, and removing dead code

lessons.title: Making sure nothing breaks
masteryOutcomes: Re-run tests to confirm consistent behavior after refactoring

lessons.title: ⚙ Practice Lesson: To-do list refactor
masteryOutcomes: Practice safely refactoring a small to-do list program while relying on tests to ensure behavior stays the same and reflecting on professional coding habits used.

lessons.title: Balancing planning and coding
masteryOutcomes: Explain trade-offs between planning and immediate coding

lessons.title: Breaking the problem
masteryOutcomes: Break down a problem into ordered pseudocode steps

lessons.title: ⚙ Practice Lesson: Recipe planner pseudocode - Part 1
masteryOutcomes: Practice weighing planning versus immediate coding while breaking a recipe-planning problem into clear, ordered pseudocode steps.

lessons.title: ⚙ Practice Lesson: Recipe planner pseudocode - Part 2
masteryOutcomes: Practice refining and reorganizing your recipe-planning pseudocode to make the steps more precise, ordered, and ready to translate into code.

masteryOutcomes: Apply numbering and indentation to represent sequence and hierarchy in pseudocode

lessons.title: Turning rules into code
masteryOutcomes: Translate rules into consistent code actions

masteryOutcomes: Practice writing hierarchical, numbered, and indented pseudocode that captures the rules of a library book checkout process.

masteryOutcomes: Practice translating structured pseudocode rules for a library checkout system into consistent, rule-based code actions.

lessons.title: Reviewing the plan
masteryOutcomes: Identify logical gaps or overlaps in pseudocode

lessons.title: From plan to working machine
masteryOutcomes: Translate pseudocode into working Python code step by step

lessons.title: Keeping comments that connect to pseudocode
masteryOutcomes: Maintain comments that connect code to pseudocode blocks

lessons.title: ⚙ Practice Lesson: Cafe order helper
masteryOutcomes: Translate a commented pseudocode plan into clear, working Python code while preserving comments that map directly to each pseudocode block.

lessons.title: Creating function stubs for structure
masteryOutcomes: Write function stubs that define intended structure

lessons.title: Building code incrementally
masteryOutcomes: Use hardcoded return values as placeholders
Replace stubs with working implementations incrementally

lessons.title: Creating test tables for pseudocode plans
masteryOutcomes: Build input-output test tables for pseudocode plans

lessons.title: ⚙ Practice Lesson: Movie night planner
masteryOutcomes: Design function stubs, use placeholder return values, and build a simple planner incrementally while using a test table to guide and verify implementation.

masteryOutcomes: Perform dry runs using pseudocode test-table values

lessons.title: Integrating logic into a full app
masteryOutcomes: Integrate validated inputs, logic, and output formatting into one app

lessons.title: ⚙ Practice Lesson: Budget tracker - Part 1
masteryOutcomes: Use a test table to dry run pseudocode for a budget tracker and confirm that the planned logic matches expected inputs and outputs before coding.

masteryOutcomes: Integrate validated inputs, core budget logic, and formatted summaries into one cohesive Python app based on the dry-run plan.

masteryOutcomes: Demonstrate working apps with multiple test cases

masteryOutcomes: Demonstrate a working fitness log app using multiple test cases and document how each case flows through the code.

masteryOutcomes: Create structured Python problem statements with success criteria

lessons.title: Defining example inputs and outputs
masteryOutcomes: Provide example inputs and outputs for normal and edge cases

lessons.title: Breaking down into subproblems
masteryOutcomes: Decompose problems into subproblems

lessons.title: ⚙ Practice Lesson: Movie night planner
masteryOutcomes: Practice writing a structured problem statement, defining example inputs/outputs (including edge cases), and breaking the problem into clear subproblems for a simple “movie night planner” app.

masteryOutcomes: Define clear inputs and outputs for subproblems

lessons.title: Sequencing subproblems logically
masteryOutcomes: Arrange and implement subproblems in logical sequence

lessons.title: ⚙ Practice Lesson: Cafe cashier - Part 1
masteryOutcomes: Define precise inputs and outputs for each subproblem in a cafe cashier checkout flow, including handling discounts, tax, and edge cases.

lessons.title: Matching subproblems to patterns
masteryOutcomes: Apply common coding patterns to subproblems

lessons.title: Prioritizing tasks
masteryOutcomes: Understand how task prioritization creates an efficient workflow that advances goals by importance and impact.
Demonstrate and explain the rationale for prioritization decisions using clear criteria like impact, dependencies, risk, and effort.

lessons.title: ⚙ Practice Lesson: Task scheduler
masteryOutcomes: Match subproblems in a simple task scheduler to common coding patterns (loops, conditionals, accumulators, lookups) and justify those choices.

masteryOutcomes: Combine functions into pipelines where outputs feed subsequent inputs

masteryOutcomes: Decompose a real-world case study into subproblems

masteryOutcomes: Break down a fitness tracker case study into subproblems and design functions whose outputs can feed into each other as a data-processing pipeline.
